can.definition: used to indicate ability or possibility
examples: I can play the guitar.
Can you come to the party tonight?
I can't swim very well.

could.definition: used to indicate past ability or possibility, or to make a polite request
examples: I could speak French when I was younger.
Could you pass me the salt, please?
I couldn't understand what she was saying.

may.definition: used to ask for permission or to indicate possibility
examples: May I use the restroom?
It may rain later today.
She may come to the party if she finishes her work.

might.definition: used to indicate a slight possibility or to make a polite suggestion
examples: I might go to the movies tonight.
You might want to try the seafood.
It might rain later, so bring an umbrella.

shall.definition: used to make a suggestion or to ask for guidance
examples: Shall we go for a walk?
What shall I do about this problem?
Shall I bring a dessert to the party?

should.definition: used to give advice or to indicate obligation or expectation
examples: You should see a doctor if you're feeling sick.
I should finish my homework before watching TV.
Shouldn't you be studying for your exam?

will.definition: used to indicate future action or certainty
examples: I will call you later.
She will be at the meeting tomorrow.
I won't be able to attend the party.

would.definition: used to indicate a hypothetical or past action, or to make a polite request
examples: If I had more time, I would visit my family.
Would you like some coffee?
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
